dt: {bc}to pass from a higher place or level to a lower one
{bc}to pass in discussion from what is logically prior or more comprehensive

dt.t: {wi}descends{/wi} from the general to the specific

dt: {bc}to originate or come from an ancestral stock or source {bc}{sx|derive||}

dt.t: a desk that has {wi}descended{/wi} in the family

dt: {bc}to conduct {d_link|nerve impulses|nerve impulse} away from the brain

dt.t: … lesions that interrupt the {wi}descending{/wi} pathways from the cortex or brain stem produce weakness in voluntary movements …

dt: {bc}to swoop or pounce down (as in a sudden attack)
{bc}to appear suddenly and often disconcertingly as if from above
{bc}to proceed in a sequence or gradation from higher to lower or from more remote to nearer or more recent

dt.t: Their scores were listed in {wi}descending{/wi} order.

dt: {bc}to lower oneself in status or dignity {bc}{sx|stoop||}
{bc}to worsen and sink in condition or estimation
{bc}to pass from higher to lower musical notes
{bc}to pass, move, or climb down or down along

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}descendre{/it}, from Latin {it}descendere{/it}, from {it}de-{/it} + {it}scandere{/it} to climb {ma}{mat|scan|}{/ma}
shortdef: to pass from a higher place or level to a lower one
to pass in discussion from what is logically prior or more comprehensive
to originate or come from an ancestral stock or source : derive

dt: {bc}to have (something or someone in the past) as an origin or source

dt.t: Recent evidence supports the theory that birds {it}descended from{/it} dinosaurs.
The plants {it}descend from{/it} a common ancestor.
They claim to {phrase}be descended from{/phrase} a noble British family.

shortdef: to have (something or someone in the past) as an origin or source

dt: {bc}to become owned by (someone) when the former owner has died {bc}to become an inheritance to

dt.t: The estate {it}descended to{/it} her from her grandparents.
She was desperate for money, but she would not {it}descend to{/it} asking her friends for help.

shortdef: to become owned by (someone) when the former owner has died : to become an inheritance to

dt: {bc}to behave as badly as someone who has treated one wrongly

dt.t: Despite my opponent's personal attacks against me, I refuse to {it}stoop to his level{/it}.

shortdef: to behave as badly as someone who has treated one wrongly
